posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Hmm, it seems we have several problems here, but maybe there is a way to circumvent them. First let me ask you something about your server. Is the dark blessing from Blackguard capped there too? If not then we can change the build somewhat to have this instead of Paladin and still get the bonus to our saves from the high Charisma. But i think its hard they missed that..,

Apart from that, you have to understand that this is a build that works much better in a lvl 40 environment and that incorporate it into Amia's 30 lvl one will need some changes. Thankfully "exalted sorceress" takes Auto-still 3 feat within the 30 lvl boundaries so you won't have a problem with that at least. But what about the expertise/ improved expertise feats, does your server also forbid the usage of these feats while casting? Many other PW's have done that by enabling the auto-switch in the toolset. In that case you need to replace these feats with something else, for example power attack & cleave in case we can take Blackguard instead of Paladin.

Finally, for the dexterity you don't need it at 12. Not from a power-gaming point of view. If it was me, i would simply trust into in-game equipment plus personal buffs to raise those numbers where i want them (12 DEX & 14 STR) and start with STR 10, DEX 08, CON 14, INT 14, WIS 08, CHA 18 for example. Also i would not take combat casting/ improved combat casting at all in your limited environment, since i would not have the plethora of feats normally available in a lvl 40 PW.

I hope i helped somewhat,

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
davidbrozza wrote:
I don't think I need Power Attack & Cleave, especially if I'm not taking a Paladin / Blackguard.
You only need Cleave if you want to take Blackguard. And you get Cleave for free when you take Monk.
Power attack is only needed if you want to qualify for Divine shield. But then you also need Str 13 and at least 3 levels of BG or Paladin or 1 level of Cleric to get Turn undead. In that respect Cleric is a viable alternative to Paladin and BG since the bonus to saves from Divine grace/Dark blessing is limited. DS gives a good boost to AC, but building that way deviates from the "Exalted sorceress" proper.
And last question Are you sure about the 12 DEX? I mean, this build's creator was a genius, he must have done that for a reason... Maybe it's needed for Monk's Evasion?
The Exalted sorceress is a premium example of a power build. You have 38 caster levels which is almost as powerful as 40 levels. And you get a LOT from the two levels of Paladin and Monk:
1 level of Paladin gives the AC of a warrior from the Heavy armor and Shield proficiencies. With the Auto still feats, you can cast in full armor without any restrictions.
The single paladin level also gives a gigantic + 10-16 boost to all saves from Divine grace.
The Monk level gives access to Tumble as class skill. 40 ranks grants +8 to AC. Monk also gives Evasion which works very well together with the high saves vs many spells and traps.
Both Paladin and Monk have Discipline as class skill. A high Discipline rank protects against Knockdown and certain other special attacks.

As for the 12 Dex, it is quite simple. A Full plate armor gives +8AC and allows a +1 AC from Dexterity. With 12 Dex you get that +1 AC.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I suggested Power Attack & Cleave before simply because he was going to take that Monk lvl as his last one, so he could not possibly qualify for BG and take these three lvls at the same time, as there would not be enough lvls to do so. But it seems that the builders didn't miss that point too, so it is just a hypothesis anyway.

David, this is what i was talking about when i said it is tough to fit a lvl 40 power-build into a lvl 30 environment that has further gimped a portion, of it's two additional sources of power. Keep the concept but adjust to your needs is what i suggest. Things to keep are definitely the Auto-still 3 feats & ESF: Necromancy in Epics along with that last lvl of Monk if you care about end-game power.You do want to add another class to the mix like Paladin for the fear immunity & Divine Shield but you need to adjust your build in chunks of three, since there is where Sorcerers take their Epic bonus feats. Something like Sorcerer 26/ Paladin 3/ Monk 1 would be the ideal split for that. But something tells me that they have limited the amount of AC you can get from Divine Shield according to the Paladin/BG lvls? If that's true then go Straight Sorcerer 29/ Monk 1 and be done with it, it is not like the build will be bad anyway, no true Caster is!

To capitalize. The Original "Exalted Sorceress" was build with the concept of an Armoured Caster in mind that drew power from token lvls of additional classes that had great synergy with her main stat (CHA). You do need Heavy Armour proficiency to take full advantage of that and Paladin will give you that for free along with fear immunity and Divine Shield. Monk at last lvl will give you Evasion, Cleave & full Tumble Ranks & allow you to max Discipline. That is why the (Sorceress 26/ Paladin 3/ Monk 1) split is ideal for you. You will get 6 Epic feats to play with including the bonus from Epic Sorceress. You will need 3 for the Auto-still feats, 1 for the ESF: Necromancy and you will have 2 more to play with. Take with both of them Great CHA feats to end in a nice even score of 26 (38). Finally adjust your initial stats to the following: STR 13 DEX 08 CON 14 INT 14 WIS 08 CHA 17

Pre-epic you will need Power attack before you can take Divine Shield at your third Paladin lvl. Also you need Still spell for the Auto-still epic line & Sf and Gr. Sf: Necromancy. You will have four feats left that is up to you. Empower spell & Extend spell are both very good choices and you can also pick up Spell Penentration & Greater Spell Penentration to cover up your four lost Caster levels. Maximize spell ain't that good nor is Toughness.


And that's all man, i hope i helped you build that lvl 30 "Exalted Sorceress" you so wanna play

EDIT: And yes, i am sure about that DEX being left at base value. Let it sink to the bottom of the sea all the way to (08), a single Undispellable cast of Cat's Grace from you will rise it up to 12 where you get full AC bonuses.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
You most likely want Paladin lvls before epics and the monk lvl last to maximize Discipline and Tumble. But you can take it as early as 27th and at least max Tumble with the Monk. It will give you Evasion earlier too.

INT 14 is required for skills, since Sorcerers don't have many skill points (only 2) and you typically need Spellcraft, Concentration, Tumble, Discipline & have some spare skills for server specific things, like you said lore or whatever. You can do with as much as 12 INt but not lower than that, at least not for me.

Also if you checked my last post i said you to go with a Paladin 3/ Monk 1/ Sorcerer 26 Build instead and Starting abilities of : STR 13 DEX 08 CON 14 INT 14 WIS 08 CHA 17, so you would be able to get Divine Shield but that's okay now, keep playing, casters are strong even without Divine Shield or Might. Take 1 Paladin lvl pre-epic to give you CHA modifier to saves (a massive boost) plus all the armour proficiencies and take Monk the earliest at 27th lvl to max Tumble and get your Evasion. Don't forget you need "still spell" before you can take the "Auto Still" feats in Epic. Max Discipline when you take that Paladin lvl and again when you take Monk. That's all man, keep us informed how it goes
